entry.p: When I have a book in my hand, I can usually be found reading all that heavy stuff like Nietzsche (just wait until I decide to re-read all of Aristotle!). So yesterday I took a little break and devoured two of my favorite books for young adults: The Wonderful O by James Thurber and The Phantom Tollbooth by Norton Juster. Both are highly recommended for kids from ages 10 to 100.
